name: The Blue Robe
flavor1: Menas entered Elisa's council chambers at Arankh, immediately spotting a young woman reading an incomprehensibly large tome. She barely glanced up when he approached. 'On swift hoof I have arrived. Where is Elisa?' he said.
flavor2: 'Yeah, hi! Elisa is out for a bit. But I can help you! We received your message - and yes, you've got big problems! I sure wouldn't want to live in Brightdune right now. You understand the aetheric side effects of transwilderness channeling, correct? And the implications for a military assault west of Boars Pass?'
flavor3: Menas stared blankly back at the young, perky face rambling at him. She barely stopped for breath between words. All he could think of was the way Keel spoke when Menas made the horrible mistake of asking him about his latest gadget.
flavor4: '...and so, under no circumstances should you head into Gravewood without an abjurative elm root. By the way, I'm Yasmina, not sure if I said that, so each time you...'

name: Forager's Curiosity

flavor2: 'Haha!' a female voice said from above, the suddeness making Keel stumble back and fall right on his backside. 'I knew my tome was around here somewhere. Let's see, where is it...'
flavor3: The book attached to Keel's belt glowed blue suddenly, a ringing echoing through the trees. A young woman dropped out of the trees and nearly fell flat on her face, but a pillow of air caught her and set her upright. A magic user?
flavor4: 'Uh, hi,' Keel said, reaching for the book. 'I think this might belong to you.'

My lady in the Guild of Scribes is also aware, and I am fully authorized to speak for her.'

Humans couldn't change their nature.
flavor2: Yet. Some part of Oniri's past called out with echoes from the dawn of knowledge. The pattern bore preserving, and Oniri was an instrument of its will.
flavor3: Oniri moved quietly through the desolate cave, memories flooding black. They found the Autarch's threads channeled out far to the north. Towards the first forest, harnessing the psychic maelstrom.
flavor4: Oniri moved their skeletal hands over the sorcerous veil. The raw mana could be changed into many forms, perhaps even used to restore the balance. Not that it mattered, but Oniri was strangely compelled.

flavor3: A thorny whip wrapped around Lucia's neck, cutting off her air and piercing her skin. She worked her fingers between the plant and her throat enough to swipe the knife through. She couldn't stall anymore. The Autarch was waiting.

flavor3: Thea watched them stroll in. Zarrah and her entourage wearing glittering finery, Hogel and Taichu smiling and greeting everyone, Elisa enrobed in blue, and Tatiala unassumingly coming in later.

name: The Severing

flavor2: Yasmina turned toward the dark and twisted forest, trying to make sense of the ominous energies emanating from within. Her efforts thwarted, she turned back to Oniri. 'There isn't any time left. No time to regroup. No time to waver. We must go in now. I hope to see you on the other side.'
flavor3: Oniri made a sound that could be mistaken for a sigh, before moving quickly into the forest.

pass_text2: Yasmina gasped for air, sweat on her brow. They had finally dismantled the animaelic forest, the manifestation of the autarch's mind. Which meant, maybe, hopefully, she'd put an end to this war herself.
pass_text3: Yasmina slumped into Oniri, laughing, forcing Oniri to catch her. 'Oh by the gods we did it!' she cried. Oniri was quiet. Yasmina managed to raise her face to meet Oniri's eyes, despite Yasmina's exhaustion.
